Question: How can I calculate the sum of an array in Java?
Please using this api: Arrays.stream.
Answer:<<<api>>>: Arrays.stream
<<<code>>>: int[] array = {1, 2, 3, 4, 5};
int sum = Arrays.stream(array).sum();
<<<explanation>>>: The sum() method of the IntStream class returns the sum of elements in this stream. This is a special case of a reduction. This is a terminal operation.
Question: Saving HTML content of any URL in a text file in Java: :I am trying to Save HTML Content of any URL  as Text file in java but its not work How save it?My code isimport java.io.*;class DemoTest {    public static void main(String st[]) {        try {            FileInputStream fis = new FileInputStream("C:\Users\Admin\Desktop\new.html");            //a.html or pass tha path of html            FileOutputStream fos = new FileOutputStream("b.txt");//to writw source in file            while (true) {                int i = fis.read();                if (i == -1)                    break;                System.out.print((char) i);//display on cmd                fos.write(i);// write the source in b.txt            }        } catch (Exception e) {        }    }}
Please using this api: PrintWriter.write.
Answer:
response:
<<<api>>>: PrintWriter.write
<<<code>>>: PrintWriter pw = new PrintWriter("b.txt");
pw.write(new FileInputStream("C:\\Users\\Admin\\Desktop\\new.html").read());
<<<explanation>>>: The write() method of the PrintWriter class writes the specified character to the file.
Question: How can I get the current time in milliseconds in Java?
Please using this api: System.currentTimeMillis.
Answer:<<<api>>>: System.currentTimeMillis
<<<code>>>: System.currentTimeMillis();
<<<explanation>>>: The currentTimeMillis() method of the System class returns the current time in milliseconds.
Question: How can I get the current time in seconds in Java?
Please using this api: System.currentTimeMillis.
Answer:<<<api>>>: System.currentTimeMillis
<<<code>>>: System.currentTimeMillis();
<<<explanation>>>: The currentTimeMillis() method of the System class returns the current time in milliseconds. You can use the following code to get the current time in seconds:
<<<code>>>: long currentTime = System.currentTimeMillis() / 1000;
<<<explanation>>>: The currentTime() method of the System class returns the current time in seconds.
